intro: Apinagia preissii, commonly known as the sand thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy soils. It has a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, gray-green leaves. Apinagia preissii produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
